content.description: This route is a worthy alternative if Orange Oswald area is full (when is it not?), and thus is less greasy and heavily traveled.  The newest guide lists it as "5.10," and it feels about 10a. Fun, slightly overhanging moves past the first three bolts are the crux, with some crazy serrated vertical seams to carefully sink your fingers into.  The face above is much reminiscent of the top of Lickety Split and its neighbors further down the Satisfaction wall, which is to say fun and pleasant.
content.location: Locate a small spur trail to your left as you walk towards Orange Oswald, after you pass Satisfaction Guaranteed.  This is the route in the middle of the face.

content.description: Climb up the crack until it ends about halfway up the cliff - traverse left (stay low if you want gear) and finish on the bolted line to the left. There's no anchor straight up. Apart from at the crux, this crack is surprisingly featured.
content.protection: standard gear, draws for finishing on the bolted route.
content.location: Slightly uphill past the area with 'Satisfaction Guaranteed', this is the crack about 10' right/uphill from the bolted line Useless Beauty. Look for the easy-looking crack that stops a little more than halfway up the cliff.

climbs.name: Two Finger Limit
climbs.fa: Greg Beil, Tanya Stiegler, Brian Talbert, 1996

content.description: You can start this climb by climbing the first part of Make Way for Dyklings and then traversing left to reach the first bolt.  (Not 5.8 as listed in Cater guide, more like 5.10a).   Otherwise, you can do a direct start by climbing out of the small cave to reach the first bolt, 5.11c).  The bottom is certainly the crux, no matter how you start it.  Climb up the nice face on good holds to the top.  The top may be a bit dirty.
content.location: Same start as Make Way for Dyklings.

content.description: Start by climbing the dirty slabby moves up and right to reach the first bolt.  Continue trending right, then straight up passing a very small overhang.  Continue on sloping holds to the finish.   There's another sport route buried in the lichen just to the right(3/09).
content.location: This is the first bolted line that you will come to as you reach the main Satisfaction wall.  There's a few routes to the left, but the trial does not lead you to them.  This is also the left most route on the face of Lickty Split.

content.description: Follow the bolts past a few horizontal cracks and your choice of slopers to the anchors.
content.location: The rightmost bolted route on the Satisfaction Wall, just before the cliff breaks down.

content.description: Pull the low roof on positive holds and then trend up the slightly slabby face via technical movement to a rest at two-thirds height.  Step left to a corner and rail below the roof.  Monkey out the roof and trend up the slightly overhanging headwall to a bolted anchor.  Classic!
content.location: After passing the Long Wall, the best of the next group of climbs (the Lichen Wall) is Satisfaction Guaranteed, an obvious face climb leading up to a large roof.

content.description:
This is the leftmost route on Satisfaction Wall.

It is better then it looks.

First clip seems high but it is not that bad once you grab big jug 8 feet up.

Start just right of the crack and work your way up and right along the arete and face.  Techy slab moves at the bottom, move through a small overhang, and then classic Summersville slopers at the top.  Solid climb albeit similar to some of the other slab climbs at Satisfaction Wall.
content.protection: 6 or 7 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor, which is shared with Tequila Maria
content.location: Just right of the crack and just left of Tequila Maria.  This is the first route you arrive at if you follow the main trail to Satisfaction Wall (there are several sport routes to the left of the crack if you turn left when you first arrive to Satisfaction Wall).

content.description: The moves off the ground are very difficult to the first bolt. Climb up the corner then step left on the face. The final section is fairly steep.
content.location: The bolted line to the right of Satisfaction Guaranteed.

content.description: Climb straight up with some interesting moves to reach the second bolt.  From here, move slightly right and up to reach a nice ledge.  This is the crux, and the hardest moves are near the bolt but there's some space before you reach the 3rd bolt above the ledge.  The holds get better and better as you proceed.
content.location: Located about 10 feet to the left of Lickty Split.

content.description: This is a really nice climb!  Start by climbing the crack system...try not to use the tree, it's close to the route.  As the crack ends, the crux is gaining the ledge above.  Follow the line straight up making use of really good face holds to the top.  Nice alternative if Orange Oswald is crowded.
content.location: This route is located directly behind a tree that is located on the trail in the center of the next main face that you will find walking from the Long Wall to the Narcissus Cave.

content.description: Begin just left of a rhodo bush. Climb up and right to a single bolt. Then continue up and right to a crack system that leads to an inside corner beneath the roof. Hand traverse left out of the roof then finish up a left facing dihedral.
content.location: To the left of Satisfaction Guaranteed.

content.description: Next line to right to "Bored Spitless" (5.10b). Stick clip to the first bolt. Start common with "Bored Spitless" then slightly right to the line of bolts. This line gets dry quickest in this section.
Climb the wide crack with some briar bushwacking to gain a ledge with some Cedar trees. Then climb the perfect hand crack splitting the upper wall to the anchor.
content.location: To the right of No Refund past the rock outcropping.
